text:
Hester Street, north side, from Suffolk (right) to Norfolk (left) Streets, as viewed across Seward Park from the Jewish Daily Forward Building on East Broadway. Note at Suffolk Street, the 2 story office of the Consolidated Edison Company and P.S. No. 62.

February 14, 1930.

P.L. Sperr

(1)
Seward Park, as viewed northeastward from the Jewish Daily Forward Building; Nos. 173-175 East Broadway, and showing Hester Street on the north side of the park. On the left is the new public school erected here to replace old No. 62. This park extends from Essex (left) on the west, to Suffolk (right) Streets on the east. The southern boundry being East Broadway.
February 14, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
An eastward view of the southern side of the Park. Photographers vantage point is on Canal Street at Essex Street and viewing to East Broadway.
May 14, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Seward Park, as viewed northeastward from the Jewish Daily Forward Building; Nos. 173-175 East Broadway, and showing Hester Street on the north side of the park. On the left is the new public school erected here to replace old No. 62. This park extends from Essex (left) on the west, to Suffolk (right) Streets on the east. The southern boundry being East Broadway.
February 14, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
An eastward view of the southern side of the Park. Photographers vantage point is on Canal Street at Essex Street and viewing to East Broadway.
May 14, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Norfolk Street, north from and including Hester Street, as seen from Seward Park.
March 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from a different angle and showing Essex Street, west side, north from but not including Hester, to and including Grand Streets. Public School No. 137 is shown in the background on the N.W. corner of Essex and Grand Streets.
March 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, but at an earlier date, showing Public School No. 75 still standing with Public School No. 62 already razed. Both schools were demolished eventually.
April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Norfolk Street, north from and including Hester Street, as seen from Seward Park.
March 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from a different angle and showing Essex Street, west side, north from but not including Hester, to and including Grand Streets. Public School No. 137 is shown in the background on the N.W. corner of Essex and Grand Streets.
March 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, but at an earlier date, showing Public School No. 75 still standing with Public School No. 62 already razed. Both schools were demolished eventually.
April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(1)
Norfolk Street, north from and including Hester Street, as seen from Seward Park.
March 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, from a different angle and showing Essex Street, west side, north from but not including Hester, to and including Grand Streets. Public School No. 137 is shown in the background on the N.W. corner of Essex and Grand Streets.
March 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same as No. 2, but at an earlier date, showing Public School No. 75 still standing with Public School No. 62 already razed. Both schools were demolished eventually.
April 20, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

Seward Park
Essex street is behind the Pavillion and the three main streets are Canal, Hester & Grand.
c. 1933271 - A breathing Space in New York's East Side.
Fairchild Aerial Camera Corporation
This print is from Neg. No. 3271.
Detroit, Mich. Public Library. June 10, 1947.
